text:
Calculated with decimals instead of whole percents, we would get:
o? = 0.00356 and o = 10.00356 = 0.05966 = 5.97%
Since the population standard deviation and population mean are both expressed in
the same units (percent), these values are easy to relate. The outcome of this example
indicates that the mean return is 22% and the standard deviation about the mean
is 5.97%. Note that this is greater than the MAD of 4.8%, a result (o > MAD) that
holds in general.
